titleStmt.title: Thomas P. Daugherty to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG4710

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p: At the last term of the Bath Circuit, Court, I was fined, $20 for one act of Retailing, I was acting as the Bar keeper of Isaac, Shrout, Whos had, been, a licensed Tavernkeeper and I thought, he was then, but, the license had run out, I made no proffet myself and had no interest in the matter in anaway. I hope the Gov. will remit the, states part of the fine-
We have no doubt. This petition is true and we hope the Gov. will remit the fine,

V. B. Young C B C C
E. V. Brothers
J. W. Barnes
Jas. M. Richards
B. Stert
Daniel Harper, S. B. C.
Wm Richards
J A Trumbo
R. Coulthard C. B. C
James Ragland
George Coyle Sr
M. P. Stephens
The indictment was found while I was Comth. Atto. The witness was ^n^ in the Rebel army I was acting for and made, Dougherty let the Judment go James

Bath Cir Ct
vs
Thos P Dougherty
$20
Tipling
11th Mch/1864

Remit except fees & costs
Tho E Bramlette
